snippet: If he wins the Wisconsin primary on Tuesday, Mitt Romney could take firm control of the Republican presidential nominating contest for the first time.
abstract: Wisconsin polls show Mitt Romney leading Rick Santorum in Republican presidential primary; victory would neutralize his most powerful critics and rally a broad spectrum of conservatives behind him as party leaders grow increasingly eager to take on Pres Obama.

byline.original: By JEFF ZELENY and JIM RUTENBERG
byline.contributor: Jeremy W. Peters contributed reporting from Waukesha, Wis.

lead_paragraph: If he wins the Wisconsin primary on Tuesday, Mitt Romney could take firm control of the Republican presidential nominating contest for the first time.

headline.seo: Romney Looks to Wisconsin Primary for Closure
headline.main: In Wisconsin, Romney Nears the Tipping Point
headline.print_headline: In Wisconsin, Romney Nears the Tipping Point
